messages.messageBody:
very nice post!


--- On Tue, 12/30/08, swissarmy_wife <heatherbean@...> wrote:

From: swissarmy_wife <heatherbean@...>
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Re: parentalrights.org?
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, December 30, 2008, 8:06 AM






I don't post much these days. I've been busy with my growing family
and my computer time has significantly gone down! Anyway... I saw
this and wanted to share. I wrote a blog about this a long time ago
and thought it might be of some interest.

http://www.swissarm ywife.net/ 2008/02/hslda- and-parentalrigh tsorg.html

I am aware that whether or not our parental rights are already
protected by the constitution will could be debated. I've had some
time to think since I wrote it and I'm not so sure now. Heck, with
the way government is going, I'm not sure ANYTHING is protected by the
Constitution anymore!

Enjoy!

always watching you--Robert Fulghum

and my computer time has significantly gone down! Anyway... I saw
this and wanted to share. I wrote a blog about this a long time ago
and thought it might be of some interest.

time to think since I wrote it and I'm not so sure now. Heck, with
the way government is going, I'm not sure ANYTHING is protected by the
Constitution anymore!

Enjoy!

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] parentalrights.org?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ack! Three clicks and I m looking at Michael Farris. http://www.parentalrights.org/about/board-of-directors I had a sneaking suspicion that site would lead
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 29, 2008, at 4:32 PM, Nicole Willoughby wrote:

> Im just wondering if anyone has further info about this site good
> or bad.
>
> http://www.parentalrights.org/learn/the-attack-on-parental-rights

Ack! Three clicks and I'm looking at Michael Farris.

http://www.parentalrights.org/about/board-of-directors

I had a sneaking suspicion that site would lead to a fundamentalist
Christian connection. Michael Farris and company are big against the
UN Convention on the Rights of Children.

Here's some links I sent to someone last time Michael Farris's name
came up:

> He and the pillars are responsible for crushing the livelihood of
> the unschooling mother who ran Gentle Spirit magazine.
>
> A report is here:
> http://www.homeedmag.com/seelhoffvs.welch/news.html
>
> Her reference to her court case against them is here (she won):
> http://wahomeednet.homestead.com/lawsuit.html
>
> Jesus I believe would be appalled at the behavior done in his name.
> Definitely not WWJD.
>
> And that's just on a personal level. Reading extensively about
> HSLDA is a good idea:
>
> A very good article in Salon Magazine:
> http://archive.salon.com/mwt/feature/2000/10/02/
> homeschooling_battle/index.html
>
> And a well organized collection of information at:
> http://hsislegal.com/whoishslda.asp
>
> This is old and tough going but nonetheless eye opening:
> http://homeedmag.com/INF/FREE/hsinfo_far1.html
>
> Yes, a lot of it is old. HSLDA and Michael Farris have gotten a lot
> more savvy about how they go about business. And HSLDA is
> fortunately no longer an exclusive storehouse of information on
> homeschooling so people are more likely to go to other resources
> than complain about HSLDA now.
>
> But better ability to spin their current actions doesn't change
> past behavior and the choices they consciously made as
> representatives of Christ.


Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
